title: U.S.: SFMade Announces Winners of the Citibank Local Manufacturers Awards
summary: San Francisco - SFMade, a nonprofit focused on building San Francisco's economic base by developing the local manufacturing sector, today announced the winners of the Citibank Local Manufacturer Awards:
tag-1: U.S.: SFMade Announces Winners of the Citibank Local Manufacturers Awards
tag-3: San Francisco – SFMade, a nonprofit focused on building San Francisco's economic base by developing the local manufacturing sector, today announced the winners of the Citibank Local Manufacturer Awards:
tag-4: 1st Place – $5,000: iDreamcase – www.idreamcase.com 2nd Place – $4,000: Dimension 3 – www.dimension3sf.com 3rd Place – $3,000: Woodcut Maps – www.woodcutmaps.com
tag-5: The winning companies were selected during SFMade Week May 6 – 10, a week-long celebration of San Francisco's vibrant manufacturing sector. During the week, visitors to all 25 of San Francisco's Citibank branches had the opportunity to peruse products manufactured in the city, vote for their favorite manufacturers and win cash prizes for those businesses to help them grow.
tag-6: "I think this contest definitely gave local San Francisco manufacturers the chance to be recognized and appreciated by the public and Citibank customers," said Gabi Hanoun, founder and CEO of first-place winner iDreamcase. "We were proud to be a part of it, and plan to use this award to keep producing our high-quality, handmade tablet and smartphone cases."
tag-7: SFMade is the only organization of its kind focused on building San Francisco's economic base by developing the local manufacturing sector. It works to encourage entrepreneurship and innovation, and to create employment opportunities for a diverse local workforce. Citi Community Development is a founding supporter of SFMade.
tag-8: "This new Citibank award program was beneficial on many levels," said Janet Lees, senior director for SFMade. "It increased exposure for 25 SFMade brands, got the public excited about their local manufacturing companies, and provided a nice cash boost for the three deserving winners. We are very fortunate to have Citibank as a supporter."
tag-9: Citi Citi, the leading global bank, has approximately 200 million customer accounts and does business in more than 160 countries and jurisdictions. Citi provides consumers, corporations, governments and institutions with a broad range of financial products and services, including consumer banking and credit, corporate and investment banking, securities brokerage, transaction services, and wealth management.
tag-10: Additional information may be found at www.citigroup.com | Twitter: @Citi | YouTube: www.youtube.com/citi | Blog: http://blog.citigroup.com | Facebook: www.facebook.com/citi | LinkedIn: www.linkedin.com/company/citi
tag-11: Citi Community Development Citi Community Development is leading Citi's commitment to achieve economic empowerment and growth for underserved individuals, families and communities by expanding access to financial products and services, and building sustainable business solutions and innovative partnerships. Our focus areas include: commercial and philanthropic funding; innovative financial products and services; and collaborations with institutions that expand access to financial products and services for low-income and underserved communities. For more information, please visit www.citicommunitydevelopment.com.
tag-12: SFMade SFMade is a California 501(c)(3) non-profit corporation, established in 2010 and headquartered in San Francisco. It is the only organization of its kind focused on building San Francisco's economic base by developing the local manufacturing sector. SFMade engages directly with entrepreneurs and growing small companies, all of whom are headquartered in and manufacture within San Francisco, offering industry-specific education, networking opportunities, and connecting these companies to powerful local resources. More information is available here: http://www.sfmade.org/about-us/about-sfmade/.
